_instructions.purpose: Extract specific, quantified achievements from old resumes, performance reviews, and notes
_instructions.output_format: One JSON file per job position using this schema
_instructions.achievement_quality: Each achievement should be SPECIFIC, include metrics/outcomes where possible, and represent a distinct accomplishment (not just a responsibility)
_instructions.tagging_guidance: Apply 2-6 tags per achievement. Use existing tags from resume.json where possible. See tag taxonomy below.

position_metadata.title: Job Title
position_metadata.experience_id: Match the id from resume.json (e.g., exp_003 for WebMD)

achievements.text: Specific achievement with metrics and outcome (e.g., 'Structured 15 risk-sharing partnerships worth $8M, achieving 22% higher ROI through predictive IQVIA modeling')
achievements.context: OPTIONAL: Additional context if needed for understanding (e.g., 'Part of commercial strategy transformation initiative')
achievements.metric_type: OPTIONAL: budget | percentage | count | time_saved | revenue
achievements.source_confidence: high | medium | low (based on how clearly this was stated in source material)

example_extraction.comment: Example of GOOD vs BAD extraction

bad_example.reason: Too generic, no metrics, sounds like a responsibility not an achievement

good_example.text: Structured 12 performance-based partnerships with top-tier publishers, implementing tiered ROI hurdles that increased average campaign ROMI from 1.8:1 to 2.4:1 over 18 months
